```json
{"solution": {"Original category": "Sales Expenses", "Recorded category": "Sale", "Original date": null, "Recorded date": "2024-01-13", "Original payment/receipt_status": null, "Recorded payment/receipt_status": "Paid", "Original payment_method": null, "Recorded payment_method": "Cash", "Original quantity": null, "Recorded quantity": null, "Original price": null, "Recorded price": null, "Original receive_method": null, "Recorded receive_method": null, "Original amount": "16966.19", "Recorded amount": "16966.19", "Original tax": null, "Recorded tax": null, "Original profit": null, "Recorded profit": null, "Original Preparer": "Senior Staff", "Recorded Preparer": "Senior Staff", "Original Approver": "Director", "Recorded Approver": "Director", "id": "Expense20240113001"}}
```
**Reasoning:**  
In the row with `id = Expense20240113001` and `recorded_type = Sale`, the "invoice" field states, "an invoice was issued for a Sales Expenses, totaling $16966.19." Other rows with the same ID are all of type "Sales Expenses" and "Administrative Expenses," confirming the correct category should be "Sales Expenses." The recorded value "Sale" is thus incorrect. All other fields match invoice text, so only the category field is affected.
